The easiest way to get started with ValidMind is to try out our developer framework and explore the ValidMind UI. 

## Try out the developer framework

```{mermaid}
flowchart LR
  A(Notebook <i class='fa-brands fa-python'></i>)
  B(Notebook <i class='fa-brands fa-r-project'></i>)
  A --> C(Initialize)
  B --> C
  C --> D(Data)
  D --> E(Test)
  E --> F(Train)
  F --> G(Upload)
```

For model developers, we recommend that you try our sample Jupyter notebooks to learn how you initialize the developer framework, prepare a demo dataset, run test plans, train a model, and send information to the ValidMind platform. 

See the notebooks in action:

- [ValidMind Python Library Introduction](../notebooks/intro.ipynb) {{< fa brands python >}}

## Explore the platform

You use the ValidMind UI to collaborate with model developers, owners, validators, and others involved in the on the model lifecycle.

Here's how to get started: 

1. [Log in](login.qmd).

2. For model developers:
    a. [Verify uploads](verify-developer-framework-uploads.qmd) 
    
       Check the documentation, metrics, and test results uploaded by the developer framework.

    b. [Create a new project](create-project.qmd).
    
       Learn what the initial workflow looks like.

3. For model validators:

    a. [Review model documentation](review-model-documentation.qmd).

       Collaborate with model developers on model documentation and add findings.
